searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation: Include resources last updated in the given range

searchParam.name: excludeSAMHSA
searchParam.documentation: If true, exclude all SAMHSA-related resources

searchParam.name: isHashed
searchParam.documentation: A boolean indicating whether or not the MBI is hashed

searchParam.documentation: A list of claim types to include

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation:
Only satisfy the Search if the Beneficiary's last_updated Date falls within a specified DateRange. A DateRange can include both lo and hi date values, only a lo date value, or only a hi date value.

Examples:

  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02&_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01
  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02
  • &_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01

See BFD Documentation for _lastUpdated

searchParam.name: beneficiary
searchParam.documentation:
Fetch Patient data using a FHIR IdType identifier; an IdType represents the logical identity for a resource, or as much of that identity that is known. In FHIR, every resource must have a logical ID which is defined by the FHIR specification as:

Any combination of upper or lower case ASCII letters ('A'..'Z', and 'a'..'z', numerals ('0'..'9'), '-' and '.', with a length limit of 64 characters. (This might be an integer, an un-prefixed OID, UUID or any other identifier pattern that meets these constraints.)

This class contains that logical ID, and can optionally also contain a relative or absolute URL representing the resource identity; the following are all valid values for IdType, and all might represent the same resource:

  • 123 (just a resource's ID)
  • Patient/123 (a relative identity)
  • http://example.com/Patient/123 (an absolute identity)

searchParam.name: startIndex
searchParam.documentation:
When fetching a Bundle Response using pagination, this URL parameter represents an offset (starting point) into the list of elements for the Request.

Example:

  • startIndex=100

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation:
Only satisfy the Search if the Beneficiary's last_updated Date falls within a specified DateRange. A DateRange can include both lo and hi date values, only a lo date value, or only a hi date value.

Examples:

  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02&_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01
  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02
  • &_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01

See BFD Documentation for _lastUpdated

searchParam.name: excludeSAMHSA
searchParam.documentation:
The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) is the agency within the U.S. Department of HHS that leads public health efforts to advance the behavioral health of the nation.

Setting this flag to true, modifies the request to filter out all SAMSHA-related claims ifrom the response.

Example:

  • &excludeSAMHSA=true

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation:
Fetch Patient data using a FHIR IdType identifier; an IdType represents the logical identity for a resource, or as much of that identity that is known. In FHIR, every resource must have a logical ID which is defined by the FHIR specification as:

Any combination of upper or lower case ASCII letters ('A'..'Z', and 'a'..'z', numerals ('0'..'9'), '-' and '.', with a length limit of 64 characters. (This might be an integer, an un-prefixed OID, UUID or any other identifier pattern that meets these constraints.)

This class contains that logical ID, and can optionally also contain a relative or absolute URL representing the resource identity; the following are all valid values for IdType, and all might represent the same resource:

  • 123 (just a resource's ID)
  • Patient/123 (a relative identity)
  • http://example.com/Patient/123 (an absolute identity)

searchParam.name: service-date
searchParam.documentation:
Only satisfy the Search request if a claim's thru Date falls within a specified DateRange. A DateRange can include both lo and hi date values, only a lo date value, or only a hi date value.

Examples:

  • &service-date=gt2023-01-02&service-date=lt2023-05-01
  • &service-date=gt2023-01-02
  • &_service-date=lt2023-05-01

searchParam.name: startIndex
searchParam.documentation:
When fetching a Bundle Response using pagination, this URL parameter represents an offset (starting point) into the list of elements for the Request.

Example:

  • startIndex=100

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation:
A list of one or more comma-separated claim types to be included in the request; within BFD, the claim types represent an OR inclusion logic meaning any claims matching one of the specified claim types will be checked.

Supported Claim Type values:

  • carrier
  • inpatient
  • outpatient
  • hha
  • hospice
  • snf
  • dme
  • partd

BFD also supports a wildcard claims type denoted by an * ; this includes all claim types in the filter.

Examples:

  • type=carrier,inpatient,snf,dme
  • type=outpatient
  • type=*

searchParam.name: _has:Coverage.extension
searchParam.documentation:
When searching for a Patient's Part D events information, this resource identifies the Part D contract value that will be used when determining eligibility.

Example:

  • _has:Coverage.extension=ABCD

searchParam.name: _has:Coverage.rfrncyr
searchParam.documentation:
When searching for a Patient's Part D events information, this resource identifies the reference year that will be applied when determining applicable Part D events.

Example:

  • _has:Coverage.rfrncyr=2023

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation:
Fetch Patient data using a FHIR IdType identifier; an IdType represents the logical identity for a resource, or as much of that identity that is known. In FHIR, every resource must have a logical ID which is defined by the FHIR specification as:

Any combination of upper or lower case ASCII letters ('A'..'Z', and 'a'..'z', numerals ('0'..'9'), '-' and '.', with a length limit of 64 characters. (This might be an integer, an un-prefixed OID, UUID or any other identifier pattern that meets these constraints.)

This class contains that logical ID, and can optionally also contain a relative or absolute URL representing the resource identity; the following are all valid values for IdType, and all might represent the same resource:

  • 123 (just a resource's ID)
  • Patient/123 (a relative identity)
  • http://example.com/Patient/123 (an absolute identity)

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation:
Only satisfy the Search if the Beneficiary's last_updated Date falls within a specified DateRange. A DateRange can include both lo and hi date values, only a lo date value, or only a hi date value.

Examples:

  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02&_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01
  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02
  • &_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01

See BFD Documentation for _lastUpdated

searchParam.name: cursor
searchParam.documentation:
Provide a pagination cursor for processing Patient's Part D events information; this resource identifies a numeric offset into a result set.

Example:

  • cursor=200

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: The patient identifier to search for

searchParam.name: startIndex
searchParam.documentation:
When fetching a Bundle Response using pagination, this URL parameter represents an offset (starting point) into the list of elements for the Request.

Example:

  • startIndex=100
